memory_aids.title: Poster Girl
memory_aids.author: Veronica Roth
memory_aids.synopsis: A former propaganda icon hunts for a missing child to earn freedom from the Delegation she once championed.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The Delegation harvested children while framing Sonya’s family as martyrs.
memory_aids.highlight: Gritty Seattle ruins and hacked surveillance tech color Sonya’s redemption arc.

memory_aids.title: Sea of Tranquility
memory_aids.author: Emily St. John Mandel
memory_aids.synopsis: Timelines collide when a time agent investigates a recurring anomaly linking Earth, the Moon, and humanity’s future.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Gaspery’s intervention creates the anomaly he is ordered to erase.
memory_aids.highlight: The 2203 book tour and moon colony vignettes explore art after apocalypse.

memory_aids.title: The Extinction Trials
memory_aids.author: A. G. Riddle
memory_aids.synopsis: Survivors trapped in a lethal experiment unravel memory wipes, killer machines, and a corporate plan for colonizing space.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The “shelter” is a Venusian training ground grooming them as future oligarchs.
memory_aids.highlight: A homicidal bus sequence and sacrificial plane crash reveal the trial’s stakes.

memory_aids.title: Fairy Tale
memory_aids.author: Stephen King
memory_aids.synopsis: Teenager Charlie Reade inherits a portal to a cursed kingdom and fights to heal both the realm and his dog.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Charlie’s ally Elden—Flight Killer—feeds on despair until Charlie invokes ancient names.
memory_aids.highlight: The sundial that repeatedly restores Radar gives the quest emotional urgency.

memory_aids.title: The Measure
memory_aids.author: Nikki Erlick
memory_aids.synopsis: Boxes holding lifespan strings force friends and strangers to confront mortality, politics, and personal choice.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Ben and Amie die together in a car crash moments after embracing their love.
memory_aids.highlight: Short-string support groups showcase empathy amid manufactured division.

memory_aids.title: Good Omens
memory_aids.author: Neil Gaiman and Terry Pratchett
memory_aids.synopsis: An angel and a demon team up to avert the apocalypse after the Antichrist is misplaced at birth.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Adam refuses to trigger Armageddon, undoing Heaven and Hell’s scripted war.
memory_aids.highlight: Deadpan humor about bureaucracy and prophecy keeps the end times whimsical.

memory_aids.title: Ninth House
memory_aids.author: Leigh Bardugo
memory_aids.synopsis: Yale freshman Alex Stern polices occult societies while chasing the truth behind a campus murder.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Darlington’s rescue reveals a demonic pact binding him to Alex.
memory_aids.highlight: Ritual audits expose secret-society excesses with gritty urban fantasy detail.

memory_aids.title: The City of Dusk
memory_aids.author: Tara Sim
memory_aids.synopsis: Four magical heirs vie to reopen the gates to their gods while Nexus descends into necromantic chaos.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The heirs’ ritual destabilizes Nexus, unleashing eldritch horrors instead of salvation.
memory_aids.highlight: Intersecting queer romances and divine politics heighten the stakes.

memory_aids.title: Verity
memory_aids.author: Colleen Hoover
memory_aids.synopsis: A ghostwriter uncovers a chilling manuscript suggesting a bestselling author murdered her own children.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Verity’s letter claims the manuscript was a writing exercise rather than confession.
memory_aids.highlight: Claustrophobic house settings blur reality and manipulation.

memory_aids.title: Nettle and Bone
memory_aids.author: T. Kingfisher
memory_aids.synopsis: Princess Marra completes impossible tasks, raises a bone dog, and allies with witches to save her sister from abuse.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Marra weaponizes kindness and cursed artifacts to kill the prince without damning herself.
memory_aids.highlight: Found-family banter softens the story’s dark fairy-tale edges.

memory_aids.title: Wicked
memory_aids.author: Gregory Maguire
memory_aids.synopsis: Oz is retold through Elphaba Thropp’s radicalization against the Wizard’s authoritarian rule.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Elphaba’s supposed villainy stems from political resistance, not inherent wickedness.
memory_aids.highlight: Political satire reframes familiar Oz iconography with moral ambiguity.

memory_aids.title: Mister Magic
memory_aids.author: Kiersten White
memory_aids.synopsis: Former child stars reunite for a reboot and confront the cult-like children’s show that erased their memories.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The show’s benevolent facade masks a supernatural predator feeding on belief.
memory_aids.highlight: Desert compound imagery contrasts nostalgia with creeping dread.

memory_aids.title: The Three-Body Problem Series
memory_aids.author: Liu Cixin
memory_aids.synopsis: Humanity negotiates, then battles, an alien civilization through centuries of science, strategy, and sacrifice.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Luo Ji’s dark forest deterrence holds the Trisolarans at bay—until compassion reopens danger.
memory_aids.highlight: VR game sequences and cosmic engineering feats expand the saga’s scope.

memory_aids.title: Intercepts
memory_aids.author: T. J. Payne
memory_aids.synopsis: A clandestine lab’s astral-projection experiments invite demonic bargaining and psychological collapse.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Joe’s “ally” in the beyond demands a brutal sacrifice to spare his family.
memory_aids.highlight: Hellfire imagery and body-horror set pieces drive the dread.

memory_aids.title: The Last Murder at the End of the World
memory_aids.author: Stuart Turton
memory_aids.synopsis: An isolated island community must solve a murder without the help of the AI that kept them safe from encroaching fog.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The villagers could walk through the fog all along—their fear was the true prison.
memory_aids.highlight: Fragmented timelines and AI memory gaps layer the mystery.

memory_aids.title: Until the End of the World
memory_aids.author: Sarah Lyons Fleming
memory_aids.synopsis: Cassie Forrest shepherds friends across a zombie-ravaged America while clinging to hope and chosen family.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Hard-won sanctuary is shattered when old flames resurface infected.
memory_aids.highlight: Road-trip camaraderie balances bleak undead encounters.

memory_aids.title: The Mysterious Case of the Alperton Angels
memory_aids.author: Janice Hallett
memory_aids.synopsis: An investigative writer reopens a cult case through emails and transcripts, racing rivals to protect a now-teenage survivor.
memory_aids.notable_twist: The so-called Antichrist baby is alive, hidden, and still being hunted by believers.
memory_aids.highlight: Mixed-media storytelling keeps the mystery kinetic.

memory_aids.title: House of Roots and Ruin
memory_aids.author: Erin A. Craig
memory_aids.synopsis: Verity Thaumas becomes companion to a reclusive family whose botanical experiments blur life and death.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Alexander’s father paralyzes his own sons to perfect a lineage of obedient heirs.
memory_aids.highlight: Gothic greenhouses and poisonous blooms shape the atmosphere.

memory_aids.title: The Calling
memory_aids.author: James Frey and Nils Johnson-Shelton
memory_aids.synopsis: Global teen combatants hunt Endgame keys, forming fragile alliances before being forced to kill.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Elite fighter Chi'kcoe dies from a random rockfall, proving no Player is safe.
memory_aids.highlight: Scavenger-hunt puzzles blend ancient myth with modern tech.

memory_aids.title: Thirteenth Child
memory_aids.author: Patricia C. Wrede
memory_aids.synopsis: Eff Rothmer, branded unlucky, studies frontier magic to save settlements from supernatural plagues.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Eff’s feared destructive magic becomes the cure for the blight threatening Mill City.
memory_aids.highlight: Candlelit liminal spaces show the frontier’s uncanny dangers.

memory_aids.title: Black Sheep
memory_aids.author: Rachel Harrison
memory_aids.synopsis: A prodigal daughter returns to her family’s cult-like church and confronts mirrored omens and buried secrets.
memory_aids.notable_twist: Vesper’s family intends to offer her as a sacrifice to cement their power.
memory_aids.highlight: Mirror imagery doubles Vesper’s fractured identity and dread.
